contextId.information: This exclamation shows that David is afraid of his enemies. AT: "Oh Yahweh, I have so many enemies!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh, how many are my enemies!

contextId.information: This is an exclamation that is used when something is suddenly seen or understood. It emphasizes what follows. AT: "Yes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])

The word "Oh" here  introduces an exclamation that expresses a hope or prayer. AT: "I hope that the salvation of Israel will come" or "I pray that the salvation of will come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
contextId.quote: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come

contextId.information: This exclamation expresses something the writer wishes for very much. AT: "I wish very much that I had wings like a dove" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
contextId.quote: Oh, if only I had wings like a dove!

contextId.information: This is an exclamation that should be translated with whatever exclamation of emphasis you have in your language to make it sound natural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
This is an exclamation that should be translated with whatever exclamation of emphasis you have in your language to make it sound natural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
